Posts.Content: I do not have cancer but My Sister (age 67) has DCIS Luminal Type B Stage 1A estrogen R+ & progest. negative High grade fast dividing Diagnosed a month ago with 9mm tumor removed I am interested in reading about clinical trials involving this type of cancer comparing the outcome of different treatment options such as: 1. doing nothing 2. chemo 3. radiation 4. chemo + radiation Any links to this type of research would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: Clinical trials

Posts.Content: I will reply to my own thread. After my original post I noticed the CLINICAL TRIALS CATEGORY and sniffed around there. What a Bummer. If you are looking to become a patient in a trial, that is a good thread. If you are looking for data about cancer from finished trials, forget it. So that some of you may know, the place to go is "pubmed". Google "Pubmed". The Website has a search engine to get at many thousands of completed research papers on all things Medical, cancer included. Bye Bye
Posts.Title: Clinical trials
